definitions.definition: To furnish with a deck, as a vessel.
To knock someone to the floor, especially with a single punch.
definitions.example: Wow, did you see her deck that guy who pinched her?

definitions.definition: To cause a player to run out of cards to draw and usually lose the game as a result.
(sometimes with out) To dress (someone) up, to clothe with more than ordinary elegance
(sometimes with out) To decorate (something).
To cover; to overspread.
The material from which a deck is made.
A pigment, dye etc added to something to change its colour or hue
The expense of a business not directly assigned to goods or services provided.
The items or classes of expense not directly assigned to goods or services provided.
Any cost or expenditure (monetary, time, effort or otherwise) incurred in a project or activity, which does not directly contribute to the progress or outcome of the project or activity.
Wasted money.
A smash.
The ceiling of any enclosed space below decks in a vessel.
A compartment above the seats for stowing luggage in a passenger aircraft.
The system of overhead wires used to power electric transport, such as streetcars, trains, or buses.
Data or steps of computation used only to facilitate the computations in the system and not directly related to the actual program code or data being processed.
definitions.example: Network overhead is the header data that is required to route and transport data over network, whereas fork overhead is the additional time and memory cost of creating and managing new processes within operating system.

definitions.definition: (by ellipsis) An overhead throw.
Located above, especially over the head
definitions.example: Place your luggage in the overhead lockers.

definitions.definition: Kicked over one's own head
Above one's head; in the sky.
definitions.example: birds flying overhead

definitions.definition: Per head; for each individual.
An overhead projector.
A sheet of transparent material with an image used with an overhead projector; an overhead transparency.
A financial policy by which capital projects are financed from current revenue in the operating budget rather than through borrowing.
A payment method where credit is purchased in advance, used in small amounts and topped up when required. Used especially of mobile phones and transport ticketing.
A fluctuation in spacetime caused by accelerating mass, which propagates as a wave at the speed of light.
A gravity wave.
To defile; to pollute
Not pure

A toxic chemical compound and banned weapon of mass destruction which, when inhaled or ingested, impairs nervous system functions, typically causing extreme physical distress and death by asphyxiation.
Having a pleasant or satisfying flavor; delicious.
definitions.example: You could make this tasty meal for breakfast.

definitions.definition: Having or showing good taste; tasteful.
definitions.example: These items will make an attractive and tasty display.

definitions.definition: Appealing; when applied to persons, sexually appealing.
Skillful; highly competent.
Potentially violent.
Any of various trees of the genus Betula, native to countries in the Northern Hemisphere.
A hard wood taken from the birch tree, typically used to make furniture.
A stick, rod or bundle of twigs made from birch wood, used for punishment.
A birch-bark canoe.
To punish with a stick, bundle of twigs, or rod made of birch wood.
To punish as though one were using a stick, bundle of twigs, or rod made of birch wood.
To become bald.
Becoming bald, especially having male pattern baldness
A non-contact competitive team sport played with a 175 gram flying disc, the object of which is to score points by passing the disc to a player in the opposing end zone.
Fit for service at sea.
An ideology which claims that the military is the foundation of a society's security, and thereby its most important aspect.
A focus on, or excessive use of, military force.
A pun.
An objection or argument based on an ambiguity of wording or similar trivial circumstance; a minor complaint.
definitions.example: He harped on his quibble about how the dark red paint should be described as carmine rather than burgundy.

definitions.definition: To complain or argue in a trivial or petty manner.
definitions.example: They are constantly quibbling over insignificant details.

definitions.definition: Valiant deeds in desperate times.
Brave and adventurous (albeit often reckless) actions.
A short news story printed alongside a larger one.
A block of information placed at the side of a printed page.
A block of information placed at the side of a webpage.
A short conference, between a judge and the attorneys of a case, held outside the jury's hearing; the place where this happens.
An accessory side note or aside made during a conversation, without changing the scope of the audience.
A short conversation between a smaller portion of a group held outside the hearing of the rest of the group.
To place information into a sidebar
One who abducts; a kidnapper.
A muscle which serves to draw a part out, or from the median line of the body
The plea or mode of defense under which a person on trial for a crime proves or attempts to prove being in another place when the alleged act was committed
definitions.example: to prove an alibi

definitions.definition: To provide an alibi for.
To provide an excuse for.
A biological structure found in many animals that is used for locomotion and that is frequently a separate organ at the terminal part of the leg.
definitions.example: A spider has eight feet.

definitions.definition: Specifically, a human foot, which is found below the ankle and is used for standing and walking.
definitions.example: Southern Italy is shaped like a foot.

definitions.definition: (often used attributively) Travel by walking.
definitions.example: There is a lot of foot traffic on this street.

definitions.definition: The base or bottom of anything.
definitions.example: I'll meet you at the foot of the stairs.

definitions.definition: The part of a flat surface on which the feet customarily rest.
definitions.example: We came and stood at the foot of the bed.

definitions.definition: The end of a rectangular table opposite the head.
definitions.example: The host should sit at the foot of the table.

definitions.definition: A short foot-like projection on the bottom of an object to support it.
definitions.example: The feet of the stove hold it a safe distance above the floor.

definitions.definition: A unit of measure equal to twelve inches or one third of a yard, equal to exactly 30.48 centimetres.
definitions.example: The flag pole at the local high school is about 20 feet high.

definitions.definition: A unit of measure for organ pipes equal to the wavelength of two octaves above middle C, approximately 328 mm.
(collective) Foot soldiers; infantry.
definitions.example: King John went to battle with ten thousand foot and one thousand horse.

definitions.definition: (cigars) The end of a cigar which is lit, and usually cut before lighting.
The part of a sewing machine which presses downward on the fabric, and may also serve to move it forward.
The bottommost part of a typed or printed page.
The base of a piece of type, forming the sides of the groove.
The basic measure of rhythm in a poem.
The parsing of syllables into prosodic constituents, which are used to determine the placement of stress in languages along with the notions of constituent heads.
The bottom edge of a sail.
definitions.example: To make the mainsail fuller in shape, the outhaul is eased to reduce the tension on the foot of the sail.

definitions.definition: The end of a billiard or pool table behind the foot point where the balls are racked.
In a bryophyte, that portion of a sporophyte which remains embedded within and attached to the parent gametophyte plant.
The muscular part of a bivalve mollusc or a gastropod by which it moves or holds its position on a surface.
The globular lower domain of a protein.
The point of intersection of one line with another that is perpendicular to it.
Fundamental principle; basis; plan.
Recognized condition; rank; footing.
A single tortilla chip from a dish of nachos.
A Mexican dish of tortilla chips, sometimes covered in melted cheese.
(usually Jewish) Feeling of contentment at another's successes.
A residential institution for the care and protection of orphans.
Orphanhood; the state of being an orphan.

A device used in film production, having hinged boards that are brought together with a clap, used to synchronize picture and sound at the start of each take of a motion picture or other video production.
A group of soldiers or paramilitaries detailed to execute someone, usually by rifle shot, or to discharge their weapons ceremonially at a funeral.
The characteristic of being homesick; a strong, sad feeling of missing one's home (and often left-behind loved ones, such as family and friends) when physically away.
A non-commissioned officer in the Royal Australian Navy and Royal Navy, ranking above able seaman and below petty officer.
A non-commissioned officer in the Canadian Forces Maritime Command, ranking above able seaman and below master seaman.
Thin; slim.
definitions.example: A rod is a long slender pole used for angling.

definitions.definition: Meagre; deficient
definitions.example: Being a person of slender means, he was unable to afford any luxuries.

definitions.definition: (Gaelic languages) Palatalized.
The punctuation mark ⟨,⟩ used to indicate a set off parts of a sentence or between elements of a list.
A similar-looking subscript diacritical mark.
Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the genus Polygonia, having a comma-shaped white mark on the underwings, especially Polygonia c-album and Polygonia c-aureum of North Africa, Europe, and Asia.
A difference in the calculation of nearly identical intervals by different ways.
A delimiting marker between items in a genetic sequence.

In Ancient Greek rhetoric, a short clause, something less than a colon, originally denoted by comma marks. In antiquity it was defined as a combination of words having no more than eight syllables in all. It was later applied to longer phrases, e.g. the Johannine comma.
A brief interval.
To place a comma or commas within text; to follow, precede, or surround a portion of text with commas.
A badge of office, rank, or power.
The lowest grade of commissioned officer in the United States Navy, junior to a lieutenant junior grade.
A flag or banner carried by military units; a standard or color/colour.
The principal flag or banner flown by a ship (usually at the stern) to indicate nationality.
Any prominent flag or banner.
A junior commissioned officer in the 18th and 19th centuries whose duty was to carry the unit's ensign.
To designate as by an ensign.
To distinguish by a mark or ornament.
To distinguish by an ornament, especially by a crown.
definitions.example: Any charge which has a crown immediately above or upon it, is said to be ensigned.

definitions.definition: An Indian trader, merchant, cashier, or money changer.
A tropical Indian fig tree, Ficus benghalensis, that has many aerial roots.
A type of loose gown worn in India.
A vest; an undershirt; a singlet.
(Naval slang) A camping excursion on shore, to give a ship's crew a break from shipboard routine.
The act of loosening or unfastening
Ruin; defeat, that which causes defeat or ruin.
definitions.example: His fatal flaw was his undoing. In a sense he defeated himself.

definitions.definition: Annulment; reversal
To reverse the effects of an action.
definitions.example: Fortunately, we can undo most of the damage to the system by the war.

definitions.definition: To unfasten.
definitions.example: Could you undo my buckle for me?

definitions.definition: To impoverish or ruin, as in reputation; to cause the downfall of.
The times of the day when traffic jams are commonplace, due mainly to people commuting to or from work.
definitions.example: It takes 30 minutes to drive there, but maybe 2 hours during the rush hour.

definitions.definition: The quality of being radiant, shining, bright or splendid.
The flux of radiation emitted per unit solid angle in a given direction by a unit area of a source.
One of the four competitions in a knockout tournament whose winners go on to play in the two semifinals.
The top edge of the hull of a nautical vessel, where it meets the deck.
To prevent someone from utilizing a platform to express their opinion.
Easily excited
definitions.example: The excitable puppy jumped all over the furniture.

definitions.definition: Able to be promoted to an excited state
(furniture) A long, low table, often placed before seating in a living room, on which drinks may be served, and magazines etc placed.
A device that is used for lifting and moving large objects.
A framework that is constructed over a mine or oil well for the purpose of boring or lowering pipes.
A hangman.
To hoist with, or as if with, a derrick.
To remove (a pitcher).
Of, relating to, or involving two or more governments.
A railway passenger car made so as to facilitate seeing the scenery en route, sometimes with glass sides or with a kind of open balcony at the rear.
A meal consisting of a number of grilled meats.
That which describes; a word, phrase, etc. serving as a description.
A female relative of one's generation, separated by one degree of marriage:
Co-sister-in-law: The wife of one's sibling-in-law.
(of a liquid) Giving off bubbles; fizzy.
Vivacious and enthusiastic.
Of, or relating to a prophecy or a prophet
Predicted, as by a prophecy
To bribe, especially to deter oversight.
definitions.example: I thought the guards would give us trouble, but apparently he had paid them off.

definitions.definition: To become worthwhile; to produce a net benefit.
definitions.example: Her years of Spanish classes finally paid off when she found herself in Mexico and realized she could communicate with people.

definitions.definition: To pay back; to repay.
definitions.example: He paid off the loan three months early.

definitions.definition: To pay back (repay, pay off) the entirety of a loan, thereby effecting the release of a lien on.
definitions.example: This contract requires you to pay off the car by 2025.

definitions.definition: To fall to leeward, as the head of a vessel under sail.
Dark reddish brown colour, like that of roasted sienna.
Of a dark reddish brown colour, like that of roasted sienna.
Called by the referee at the end of a match, as no side has the next possession of the ball.
A designated player that attempts to prevent the opposing team from scoring by protecting a goal.
A person who maintains natural areas or protects threatened species.
Someone who advocates for these actions.
The underside of an animal.
definitions.example: We identified the species of the snake by its blue-grey underbelly.

definitions.definition: The underside of any thing.
The side which is not normally seen, normally a dark, immoral place.
definitions.example: The area by the canal is the underbelly of town – not something you’d see in the guidebooks.

definitions.definition: Possessing or pertaining to energy.
definitions.example: Cosmic rays are energetic particles from outer space.

definitions.definition: Characterised by force or vigour; full of energy; lively, vigorous.
definitions.example: Those kids are so energetic: they want to run around playing all day.

definitions.definition: Having powerful effects; efficacious, potent.
To achieve more or at a higher level of quality than was expected.
A company owned by a parent company or a holding company, also called daughter company or sister company.
A subordinate theme.
One who aids or supplies; an assistant.
Auxiliary or supplemental.
Secondary or subordinate.
definitions.example: a subsidiary stream

definitions.definition: Of, or relating to a subsidy.
definitions.example: subsidiary payments to an ally

definitions.definition: In Africa, a teacher of the Qur'an.
The act of approving; an assenting to the propriety of a thing with some degree of pleasure or satisfaction; approval, sanction, commendation or official recognition.
A device that connects some source of signal to a television set, often decrypting a digitally encrypted signal from a communications satellite or cable network.
Brave, courageous and plucky.
Stubborn, resolute.
Abbreviation of tempore.
A temporary employee, usually in an office.
A temporary storage location.
To work as a temporary employee.
A measure of cold or heat, often measurable with a thermometer.
definitions.example: The temperature in the room dropped nearly 20 degrees; it went from hot to cold.

definitions.definition: An elevated body temperature, as present in fever and many illnesses.
definitions.example: You have a temperature. I think you should stay home today. You’re sick.

definitions.definition: A property of macroscopic amounts of matter that serves to gauge the average intensity of the random actual motions of the individually mobile particulate constituents. http//arxiv.org/pdf/physics/0004055
The state or condition of being tempered or moderated.
The balance of humours in the body, or one's character or outlook as considered determined from this; temperament.
Not permanent; existing only for a period or periods of time.
Existing only for a short time or short times; transient, ephemeral.
A literary man; a scholar or author.
An election, usually held at regular intervals, in which candidates are elected in all or most constituencies or electoral districts of a nation.
The official decree marking the legal end of a marriage, allowing the two people to remarry; it follows the decree nisi after six weeks (in Britain)
An absolute unconditional accruement of a claim's validity and legitimacy.
A person who is abused, physically or verbally, and returns to the abuser a supplicant.
A sycophant.
A child who is able to creep using his hands and knees but is not able to walk.
A crawl swimmer.
A tractor crawler, a motorized vehicle that uses caterpillar tracks instead of wheels.
A software bot that autonomously follows connected paths such as webpage links.
A mobile stage in the development of stationary hemipteran insects such as scale insects- generally the first instar
A refugee, especially of war or of forced migration.

A light, soft, baked dessert (commonly layered with cream and jam) that is typically made with flour, sugar, baking powder and eggs, and has a firm, yet well aerated structure, similar to that of a sea sponge.
definitions.example: I made a sponge cake the other day. It was a disaster: I forgot the baking powder! It didn't rise!

definitions.definition: Exactly and carefully conducted.
definitions.example: He is scrupulous in his finances.

definitions.definition: Having scruples or compunctions.
definitions.example: He is a scrupulous businessman and always acts in the best interest of his company.

definitions.definition: Precise; exact or strict
Artfully cunning; secretly mischievous; wily.
(having a positive sense) Dexterous in performing an action, so as to escape notice
Done with, and marked by, artful and dexterous secrecy; subtle
definitions.example: a sly trick

definitions.definition: Light or delicate; slight; thin.
Slyly.
One who is left-handed, especially in sports.
A boxer who leads with the right hand and guards with the left
The internal organs of an animal, used as animal food.
A by-product of the grain milling process, which may include bran, husks, etc.
A dead body; carrion.
That which is thrown away as worthless or unfit for use; refuse; rubbish.
A form of advertising where a brand or product is incorporated into non-advertising media such as films.
To move to the other side of (something, such as an obstruction) by deviating from a direct course or following a curved path.
definitions.example: The tide was too high, and we couldn't get around the rocks.

definitions.definition: To avoid or bypass an obstacle.
definitions.example: Tax consultants look for ways to get around the law.

definitions.definition: To circumvent the obligation and performance of a chore; to get out of.
definitions.example: How did you get around having to write the executive report?

definitions.definition: To transport oneself from place to place.
definitions.example: Granny uses a wheelchair to get around.

definitions.definition: To visit numerous different places.
To be sexually promiscuous.
definitions.example: Wow, she really gets around.

definitions.definition: A running race over the distance of 21.0975 km, half the length of a marathon.
One who is subordinate.
To make subservient.
To treat as of less value or importance.
To make of lower priority in order of payment in bankruptcy.
Placed in a lower class, rank, or position.
Submissive or inferior to, or controlled by authority.
(grammar, of a clause) dependent on and either modifying or complementing the main clause
definitions.example: In the sentence “The barbecue finished before John arrived”, the subordinate clause “before John arrived” specifies the time of the main clause, “The barbecue finished”.

definitions.definition: Descending in a regular series.
A blue-veined Italian cheese, made from cow's milk.
A soft, crumbly, unaged cheese resembling ricotta.
A candidate on a joint ticket.
A candidate for the the US vice-presidency.
One of a pair of ships with coordinated, often reciprocal, sailing schedules.
